intro: Pterocephalus epiroticus, commonly known as the Epirotic spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flowers that appear in clusters. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as wastelands and along roadsides. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in some areas.
